Project/Module: DDT Uptake, Accumulation, and Redistribution by Seafloor Animals
Overview: Identify benthic invertebrates in the San Pedro Basin near Dumpsite 2
Sampling area: Region: San Pedro Basin, vicinity of Dumpsite 2
Notes: Benthic invertebrate specimens from multicores collected on R/V Yellowfin cruise led by David Valentine; points represent 17 stations

PIs: Gregory Rouse, Lisa Levin, Carlos Neira
Project/Module: DDT Uptake, Accumulation, and Redistribution by Seafloor Animals
Overview: Characterize the identity, density, diversity, and distributions of benthic animals at Dumpsite 2
Analysis being conducted: Genetic and morphological identification (Rouse); statistical analyses of density, community structure, and diversity (Levin, Neira); DDX analysis (Levin, Neira)
Notes: Benthic invertebrate specimens and sediment cores collected with ROV Subastian on R/V Falkor cruise FK210726 led by Lisa Levin (chief scientist), Greg Rouse, Paul Jensen, Kira Mizell; points represent 11 sampling events on two dives (S0450, S0451)

Project/Module: DDT Uptake, Accumulation, and Redistribution by Seafloor Animals
Overview: Analysis of sediment properties in pushcores collected at varying distance from barrels in San Pedro Basin
Parameters measured: sediment: organic matter, sediment: chlorophyll, sediment: grain size, sediment: pigments
Analysis being conducted: sediment grain size (silt-clay/sand), water content and porosity, organic matter content (TOM by combustion), TOC, TN, sediment chlor a and phaeopigments (CPE)
Sampling area: Region: San Pedro Basin, vicinity of Dumpsite 2

Project/Module: DDT Uptake, Accumulation, and Redistribution by Seafloor Animals
Overview: Analysis of contaminant in sediments in 0-2, 2-4, 4-6, 6-8 8-10 cm vertical fractions and in selected animals from barrels
Analysis being conducted: DDX (DDT, DDD, DDE, DCMU); PAH, PCB
Sampling area: Region: San Pedro Basin, vicinity of Dumpsite 2

PIs: Lihini Aluwihare, Anela Choy, Eunha Hoh
Project/Module: “Fingerprint” DDT Chemistry: Identifying the chemical fingerprint of DDT sludge from Dumpsite2
Overview: Characterize the chemical fingerprint of DDT from sediments and examine transport into water column food web using preliminary samples of particles and deep biota
Analysis being conducted: DDX, PCBs, Stable C & N isotopes; Non-targeted contaminant analyses
Sampling area: Region: San Pedro Basin, vicinity of Dumpsite 2

Project/Module: Microbial Diversity in DDT polluted sediments
Overview: Analyze microbial diversity in sediment communities in 0-2, 2-4, 4-6, 6-8 8-10 cm vertical fractions by amplicon sequencing and metagenomics
Parameters measured: microbial diversity and composition, genetic potential, microbial taxonomy
Analysis being conducted: 16S rRNA amplicon sequencing, metagenomics, KS amplicon sequencing
Sampling area: Region: San Pedro Basin, vicinity of Dumpsite 2
Notes: Benthic invertebrate specimens and sediment cores collected with ROV Subastian on R/V Falkor cruise FK210726 led by Lisa Levin (chief scientist), Greg Rouse, Paul Jensen, Kira Mizell; points represent 11 sampling events on 2 dives

Overview: Bio samples of recreational fish species for detecting presence/quantity of DDT
Notes: rec fish species (collected by PIER): barred sand bass, boccacio rockfish, california scorpionfish, chub mackerel, kelp bass, ocean whitefish, pacific bonito, pacific sanddab, vermillion rockfish, california barracuda, copper rockfish, gopher rockfish, longfin sanddab, olive rockfish, speckled sanddab, white croaker

PIs: Gregory Rouse, Lisa Levin, Carlos Neira
Project/Module: DDT Pollution in Animals from different sites across the Southern California Borderland
Overview: Characterize DDX concentrations in corals and sponges from outside the Dumpsite areas
Notes: Benthic invertebrate specimens and sediment cores collected with ROV Subastian on R/V Falkor cruise FK210726 led by Lisa Levin (chief scientist), Greg Rouse, Paul Jensen, Kira Mizell;

Overview: Bio samples of mesopelagic fish species for detecting presence/quantity of DDT
Analysis being conducted: DDX, PCBs, Stable C & N isotopes; Non-targeted contaminant analyses
Notes: CalCOFI formalin preserved mesopelagic fish (Stenobrachius leucopsarus)

Project/Module: Spatial and depth-resolved distribution of DDX in San Pedro Basin
Overview: Characterizing depth resolved and integrated DDX concentrations within San Pedro Basin by grid sampling and two transect sampling expeditions
Analysis being conducted: DDX (2,4'- and 4,4'- isomers of DDT, DDE, and DDD), non-targeted contaminant analysis, CHN abundance, 14-C dating, Cs-Pb dating, stable C and N isotopes

Project/Module: DDT transfer rates and exposure in near-bottom waters in the San Pedro Basin
Overview: Assessing sediment disturbance, turbidity, sediment transport and implications for ecosystem exposure
Parameters measured: sediment: suspended, polyethylene passive sampler device (PED), water samples
Analysis being conducted: DDX from suspended sediment and PED, (plus temperature, salinity, oxygen, current speed)
Notes: time series, 6 month deployment, 48 water samples 5 m above bottom
